rogel.io.fopl.formulas

Class QuantifiedFormula

  • java.lang.Object
    • rogel.io.fopl.formulas.Formula
      • rogel.io.fopl.formulas.QuantifiedFormula
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Expression

    public class QuantifiedFormula
extends Formula
    A QuantifiedFormula is a Formula that provides additional meaning over the Variables it quantifies over. There are only two types of quantified formulas in FOPL: universal ("forall") and existential ("exists").
    Author:
    recardona

      • isAtomic

        public boolean isAtomic()
        Description copied from class: Formula
        Returns true if and only if this Formula is atomic. An atomic Formula (or equivalently, an 'atom') is a Formula that contains no logical connectives or equivalently a Formula that has no sub-formulas.
        Specified by:
        isAtomic in class Formula
        Returns:
        true if this Formula is atomic, false otherwise.

      • isLiteral

        public boolean isLiteral()
        Description copied from class: Formula
        Returns true if and only if this Formula is a literal. A literal is defined to be an atomic Formula or its negation.
        Specified by:
        isLiteral in class Formula
        Returns:
        true if this Formula is atomic or is the negation of an atomic Formula, false otherwise.

      • replaceVariables

        public Expression replaceVariables(Substitution substitution)
        Description copied from interface: Expression
        Replaces any Variable in this Expression with its binding in the Substitution, if it exists.
        Parameters:
        substitution - The Substitution set of Variables created thus far.
        Returns:
        an Expression with substituted Variables.

      • standardizeVariablesApart

        public Expression standardizeVariablesApart(java.util.HashMap<Variable,Variable> newVariables)
        Description copied from interface: Expression
        Replaces the Variables in this Expression with new copies of the Variable that have the same name. The copies are the Variables that have been standardized.
        Parameters:
        newVariables - The set of Variables that have been copied thus far.
        Returns:
        an Expression with standardized Variables.
